name: Holiday Inn Express Rawlins

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while on a western US road trip and were quite happy with this hotel. The staff were terrific. We arrived late in the evening after a long drive. The staff was warm and welcoming. We knew that options for dinner would be very limited in Rawlins, which is a small town, but the front desk staff sent us straight over to Bucks. Terrific recommendation. We are eternally grateful for their advice - saved us from having to eat at Burger King.
reviews.title: Terrific staff - great hotel - needs more parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is quite nice - comfortable, well-maintained, nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Warning - This is a Pet Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: The only issue we had was finding parking - it looked like a road crew was staying at the hotel and it was hard to find parking with all the large trucks.
reviews.title: Wonderful overnight stay

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is convinient to the Interstate, but there is some noise from the interstate - not too bad, but it is there.
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.text: Because I am very allergic to pet dandruff, I make every effort not to stay at "pet friendly" hotels. I always ask before making a reservation. I was informed that Holiday Inns do not allow pets (and have stayed at many that do adhere to this policy). Before I made this reservation I asked this question about pets and was informed, by the reservation clerk, that pets are not allowed. So I made the reservation. Unfortunately, I learned too late that this was not true. Upon arrival, I saw people with 2 pets entering the hotel. When I asked the hotel's front desk staff about the dogs, they said because they are privately owned, pets are allowed. Unfortunately another hotel that does not allow pets did not have any vacancies; therefore, we were disappointed & "stuck." So, I took a couple of Benadryl and hoped for the best. Despite my disappointment, I must give credit where credit is due. The hotel front desk & staff were very polite, pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Ok...if you don't mind the smoke!
Get place to stop during road trip
reviews.text: We stopped at the Holiday Inn Express on the last day of a road trip from Idaho to Nashville, Tennessee. We were very pleased to have this place to stay. A really nice hotel. Very friendly front desk. Our room was really nice. A suite with couch, refrigerator, microwave. Very comfortable bed. Slept great. Shower was great. Bathroom was very clean. Room was also very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good. So nice to be able to eat breakfast right at hotel before heading out to drive home.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: We will definitely come back to this hotel when traveling.
reviews.title: Rawlins, Wy. Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Rawlins on our way from Denver to Jackson Hole. It was truly fantastic! The location right next to Interstate 80 was very convenient. The staff was great and they were all smiles even though we asked for a bunch of different things at a bunch of different times. If we're ever in the area again, I would definitely book a room there. It is a bit pricier than other hotels in the area but it is worth it!
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: http://ourpinonthemap.blogspot.com/
reviews.title: Total care

reviews.text: We stayed on two separate nights withing a week. Both nights were enjoyable. The room was a little cold when we got in, but the heater worked well and warmed up the room quickly. The rooms were very clean which always makes for a good stay. Breakfast was good with the traditional cereal, toast, muffins, sausage, eggs, and pancake machine.
reviews.title: 2 nights in a week

reviews.text: Night 15 of our 2012 road trip.
reviews.title: Another good overnight stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second HIE we have used based oin TA reviews and again we were not disappointed. Newer hotel on the edge of Rawlins where we found a warm welcome,good rooms, spacious and clean and an enjoyable breakfast. Altogether awholesome experience. We drove a couple, of junctions, probably 4 miles, to eat at Cappy's which we found ok despite some poor reviews. Four of us had different dishes and all were happy at the quality and price.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The combination of oil and the Interstate seem to push up hotel prices in the area but that's what it is.It is ahotel I would happily use again and recommend.
reviews.title: Nice stay.

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I only stayed one night but the hotel was clean and quiet. Our room was large and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast which is included was excellent with a large variety of food to choose from. Also easy to get to. Would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great night sleep

reviews.text: We stayed here on August 10 after traveling back from Jackson Hole on our way to Denver. The hotel is in a great location just off of the interstate and located next to gas stations and fast food restaurants. The check in staff person was very friendly and helpful and checked us into a handicapped room that was very spacious and clean. The kids enjoyed the pool while mom and dad enjoyed the whirlpool after driving all day. The breakfast is suitable for all your likes. I would recommend staying there with family or business.
reviews.title: Great night stay!

reviews.text: A very nice place to stay the night. Turned up without a booking and got two rooms for $140 each. Building looked new and the rooms were clean and tidy. A typical Holiday Inn – nothing overly special!
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. We have stayed here numerous times on our way through WY. The pool is usually fairly warm. The breakfast is standard Holiday Inn Express but always fresh and the hostess always remembers us & is friendly. No fuss on the dog and lots of room behind the hotel for the dog to run. The hotel is always clean from the lobby to the rooms. The only thing that could be upgraded is the beds to pillow tops!
reviews.title: Very clean & maintained!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were traveling east from the Tetons and stopped in Rawlins. For the night before heading east in I-80. This hotel had all the niceties of you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. It was a newer hotel and the staff was very friendly. As a priority club member we were given a free upgrade to an executive suite. It was a nice stay in a good location.
reviews.title: Nice place for an overnight

reviews.text: Stayed here during a house hunting trip. Staff (and fellow travelers) were friendly, room was clean, all in all a good trip. My son loved the pool (although the chlorine smell was a little strong for me). Room was clean, spacious and relativley comfortable. Breakfast was standard (but hey, it's free!) When we finally moved here for good, we stayed in HIE's the whole way. Can't beat it for value and friendliness (especially when traveling with pets!)
reviews.title: Loved it!

description: The Holiday Inn Express Rawlins, a Stay Smart hotel, is conveniently located off I-80 and just a short turn off of State Highway 287. Close to local Restaurants, city center, and shopping. The hotel offers an elevator, free Continental breakfast, popcorn and cookies in the evening, microwave and refrigerators in all of the guest rooms. Rawlins is the home of the Historic Wyoming State Prison and just a few miles from the Medicine Bow National Forest and the Seminoe Reservoir. The Carbon County Fairgrounds, Carbon County Museum and the Rochell Ranch Golf Course are only minutes away. Go 40 miles and you are at Saratoga, Wyoming, go 60 miles and you are at the Sierra Madre Mountains or the Snowy Range. The Martin's Cove Handcart Center and Independence Rock are only 70 miles from Rawlins. The Natrona County International Airport in Casper Wyoming is 117 miles from Rawlins with many daily flights. Our pet friendly hotel offers complimentary high speed Internet in all of our guest rooms and public areas. The business center is equipped with a computer work station and printer. Our indoor heated pool, hot tub, and fitness center are a perfect way to relax, get fit and enjoy. Looking for meeting space? We can accommodate up to 25 people classroom style in our meeting room with 675 square feet.
